column11:
'PERFORMANCE WORK STATEMENT (PWS)
GENERAL
The contractor shall provide services for the U. S. Naval Medical Research Unit No. 6 (NAMRU-6) in
Puerto Maldonado (Amazon region)
column12: Peru during the period from May 18
column14:
2021.
Services will be paid monthly. Services will be provided 40 hours per week from Monday to Friday.
Working hours will be coordinated with the Facilities Department in the range of 0700 to 1800.
Services consist of recruiting
column15: training and placing personnel for the services detailed below.\nContractor must receive Government approval before personnel is selected for placement.\nThe contractor shall furnish all managerial
column17:
direct labor personnel and uniform that are
necessaries to accomplish all work required. Contractor employees shall be on site only for
performance of contractual duties and not for other business purposes. Performance requirements for
required work are described below.
The contractor is responsible for strict adherence to all instructions and quality requirements stated in
this contract and shall provide the appropriate management effort to ensure that all services are
performed.
The contractor shall ensure that all personnel assigned to this contract possess the skills and experience
necessary for meeting deliverables.
The services shall include the laborer to work in a laptop with internet service and work cellphone with
cell service and to have a small printer/copier/scanner necessary to accomplish all work required.
Laptop will be used to email quotes and/or receive standard operation procedures to perform work
and/or trainings. Work cellphone shall have camera in order to take pictures and report deficiencies.
Laptop to be selected and provided by contractor to run MS office minimum and adobe acrobat reader.
Preferable to be Hewlett Packard or Dell. Since laborer shall send reports via email
column18:
contractor shall
provide portable internet for this laptop. Contractor to consider also maintenance and software updates
for this equipment. Contractor to provide office paper to print documents/reports (estimate of a box of
500 sheets per month) and any other office materials (pen
column20: etc.) necessary to accomplish all\nwork required. Government will not provide cellphone
column25:
or
maintenance for any communication equipment at location. The services requested do not include any
other materials and tools or equipment in order to perform the cleaning and maintenance tasks. All
other materials
column26:
equipment and tools required for the correct execution of the work described below
will be provided by NAMRU-6.
CONTRACTOR RESPONSIBILITIES
The contractor is responsible for strict adherence to all instructions and quality requirements stated in
this contract and shall provide the appropriate management effort to ensure that all services are
performed.
The contractor shall ensure that all personnel assigned to this contract possess the skills and experience
necessary for accomplishing their individual tasks.
The Contractor must provide the name of the person of contact (POC) and his/her alternate in charge of daily communication with NAMRU-6. If these employees are going to be changed
column27: NAMRU-6 must be notified in writing three working days in advance.\nContract requires for continuity of services during the duration of the contract. Employee(s) working for the Contractor in NAMRU-6 facilities have to be cleared by Regional Security Office (RSO) at the U.S. Embassy
column29:
Peru. Personnel without a clearance check will not be allowed to provide services required per this contract.
The contractor shall ensure that their personnel assigned to provide the services required per this contract are in compliance with the local labor regulations.
The services required per this contract are stated below:
LABORER - PUERTO MALDONADO (Amazon region)
Laborer services (one laborer) are required to provide support to our laboratory in NAMRU6-Puerto Maldonado (remote site) by:
1. Performing minor repairs to electrical systems (generator
column31: etc.). Laborer shall evaluate the condition of the facilities and reports of deficiencies………………………………….30%\n2. Laborer shall act as an escort and supervise contractors during preventive and corrective maintenance of the systems of the Facility (air conditioning
column34: etc.)…………. 30%\n3. Laborer shall perform safety tasks assigned by the Safety Officer and the Environmental Officer; such as: monthly inspections of the fire extinguishers
column36: monthly inspections of eye wash station and perform related duties as required.…………………………....10%\n4. Laborer shall coordinate with garbage truck to pick up hazardous waste………………………10%\n5. Laborer shall participate in moving when required of heavy furniture and/or laboratory equipment. Laborer shall coordinate with courier for all delivers except confidence materials. Laborer shall register all material received and delivered by the courier service. Laborer shall move supplies to proper storage areas
column37: using hand truck and other material handling equipment………………………………………10%\n6. Laborer is responsible for reporting broken windows
column39: and leaking plumbing and for securing premises after workday is completed. Laborer shall clean floor and furniture of laboratories and any other assigned area…………………………………………………………… 10%\nThe Contract will include round trip transportation service due to the NAMRU-6 is located about 3 km of the City downtown
column40: as attached in the below list:.\nCompletion of high school education is required. Technical training in Electricity is required (400 hours minimum). Laborer shall be fluent (Level III) in Spanish.'
